#summary The client downloads a .torrent file (and the actual torrent, or should this be another use case?)

= Introduction =

The user queries the server for the .torrent file and downloads it if it is there. Then the user downloads the torrent file.


= Details =
Actors: *User, File Server, Database Server, Torrent Tracker*
Flow of events:
# *User* selects file in file browser portion of program
# *User* selects download
# Client sends out a request to the *File Server* for the .torrent file
          # *File Server* queries *Database Server* as to the status of the file
          # *Database Server* returns status of .torrent file to *File Server*
          # *File Server* returns status of .torrent file to *User*
# If .torrent file is available, client downloads it from *File Server*
# Client performs checksum on .torrent file to make sure it was transferred successfully
# Client queries *Torrent Tracker* for list of other clients with file or files defined by .torrent file
          # *Torrent Tracker* returns list of clients if it exists, error if not
          # *Torrent Tracker* adds client to list of clients downloading file
# Client queries other clients to find out who had what pieces of file or files
          # Other clients reply and specify what data is available for download
# Client downloads files piece by piece
